body:
This appears to be the same issue as with vtk in #24237, but because paraview appears to be building its own vtk (why???), it faces the same error.

Basically, as of freetype@2.10.3, freetype is no longer exporting FT_CALLBACK_DEF, which causes problems in vtk builds.
Since paraview is building its own vtk, the patch for #24237 needs to be applied here as well (unless we get paraview to use the separately installed vtk, but I am assuming that such is non-trivial.  At least beyond what I can feasibly do just now.).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install paraview@5.8.0 %gcc@8.4.0 ~advanced_debug build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~cuda cuda_arch=none
      ~examples +hdf5 +ipo +kits +mpi +opengl2 ~osmesa +plugins ~python +python3 +qt +shared
...

 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/lustre/jn10/devspackswinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-paraview-5.8.0-wgwjppjnxwcruk2rs6be4d3yroboiu7m/spack-src/VTK/Rendering/FreeType/vtkFreeTypeTools.cxx: In member function 'virtual FT_Error vtkFreeTypeTools::CreateFTCManager()':

     this->MaximumNumberOfSizes, this->MaximumNumberOfBytes, vtkFreeTypeToolsFaceRequester,
                                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

make: *** [Makefile:133: all] Error 2
```
